patterns: I feel worthless
I can't find joy in anything
I'm always tired
I'm constantly sad
I have no motivation

symptoms: Persistent feelings of sadness, loss of interest in activities, changes in appetite or sleep, fatigue, feelings of worthlessness.
recommendations: Seek support from a mental health professional. Regular exercise, a healthy diet, and staying connected with loved ones can also be helpful.

patterns: I feel down most of the time
I've been feeling low for years
It's hard to remember the last time I was happy
I'm always in a low mood
I feel hopeless

symptoms: Chronic state of depression lasting for at least two years, low energy, low self-esteem, difficulty concentrating.
recommendations: Professional therapy and medication can be effective. Establishing a routine, engaging in enjoyable activities, and practicing mindfulness can also help.

patterns: I have extreme mood swings
Sometimes I'm really happy, then I'm extremely sad
I go from being energetic to very depressed
I experience highs and lows
My moods are unpredictable

symptoms: Extreme mood swings between manic and depressive episodes, elevated mood, increased activity during mania, sadness or hopelessness during depression.
recommendations: Treatment usually involves medication and psychotherapy. Maintaining a stable routine, avoiding triggers, and having a support system are crucial.

patterns: I feel depressed during the winter
My mood drops when there is less sunlight
I feel better in the summer
I have no energy in the winter
I crave carbohydrates during the winter

symptoms: Depression occurring at certain times of the year, usually in winter, low energy, overeating, difficulty concentrating.
recommendations: Light therapy, spending time outdoors, and physical activity can help. Consulting with a healthcare provider is also recommended.

patterns: I hear voices that others don't
I have strange beliefs that worry me
I feel disconnected from reality
I see things that aren't there
I feel paranoid

symptoms: Distorted thinking and awareness, hallucinations, delusions.
recommendations: Seek immediate help from a mental health professional. Treatment often involves antipsychotic medications and therapy. Staying connected with trusted friends and family can also provide support.

patterns: I feel very down after giving birth
I'm struggling to bond with my baby
I feel overwhelmed and sad since becoming a parent

recommendations: Reach out to a healthcare provider
Join a support group for new parents
Ensure adequate rest and self-care
Talk to a therapist specializing in peripartum issues
Consider medication if recommended by a doctor

patterns: I feel extremely irritable before my period
My mood is very low right before menstruation
I have severe PMS symptoms

recommendations: Consult with a healthcare provider
Consider lifestyle changes like regular exercise and a balanced diet
Track your symptoms to discuss with a doctor
Explore therapy options for mood management
Medication such as antidepressants may be recommended

patterns: I'm feeling really down after a big change in my life
I can't cope with this recent stressful event
I feel depressed after losing my job

symptoms: Sadness or hopelessness related to a specific event
recommendations: Seek support from friends and family
Consider talking to a counselor or therapist
Practice stress-reducing activities like yoga or meditation
Maintain a routine to provide structure
Focus on self-care and healthy habits

patterns: I feel better when good things happen but still depressed overall
I feel very tired and my limbs feel heavy
I crave sweets and sleep too much

symptoms: Mood reactivity (mood brightens in response to positive events)
Heavy feeling in arms or legs
recommendations: Consult with a healthcare provider
Consider therapy, such as cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT)
Antidepressant medications may be helpful
Engage in regular physical activity
Build a support system with friends and family

patterns: I've tried many treatments but still feel depressed
No medication seems to help my depression
Therapy isn't working for me

symptoms: Persistent feelings of sadness or hopelessness
Lack of response to multiple treatments
recommendations: Consult with a specialist in treatment-resistant depression
Explore alternative treatments like ECT or TMS
Consider combining medication with different types of therapy
Ensure comprehensive lifestyle changes are in place
Look into clinical trials for new treatments

patterns: I feel anxious about everything
I'm constantly worried and can't relax
My anxiety affects my daily life

recommendations: Consult with a healthcare provider
Consider cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT)
Practice relaxation techniques like deep breathing or meditation
Regular physical activity
Medication may be prescribed by a doctor

patterns: I have sudden, intense episodes of fear
My heart races and I can't breathe during attacks
I fear having another panic attack

symptoms: Fear of losing control or dying
recommendations: Seek help from a healthcare provider
Learn and practice breathing exercises
Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) can be effective
Avoid caffeine and other stimulants
Medication may be helpful in managing symptoms

patterns: I have an intense fear of specific things
I avoid places because of my fear
My fear of something specific disrupts my life

symptoms: Intense and irrational fear of specific objects or situations
Panic or severe anxiety when exposed to the phobia trigger
Physical symptoms like sweating and trembling
recommendations: Consider exposure therapy with a trained therapist
Learn and practice relaxation techniques
Gradual exposure to the feared object or situation
Join a support group
Medication may be prescribed to help manage anxiety

patterns: I feel extreme distress when away from loved ones
I worry something bad will happen to my loved ones
I can't stand being apart from my family

symptoms: Excessive distress when anticipating or experiencing separation
Worry about losing major attachment figures
Refusal to be alone or sleep away from home
Physical symptoms like headaches or stomachaches
recommendations: Consult with a healthcare provider
Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) can be effective
Gradual exposure to separation
Develop a consistent routine
Consider family therapy
